prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism with a Hollow Center and a Cylindrical Hole Step 1: Create the coordinate system Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the Euler angles set to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and the translation vector set to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. Step 2: Draw the 2D sketch for the outer rectangular prism Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. Draw a rectangle by creating four lines: 1. Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.7313, 0.0] 2. Line 2: Start Point [0.7313, 0.0], End Point [0.7313, 0.75] 3. Line 3: Start Point [0.7313, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.75] 4. Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Step 3: Draw the 2D sketch for the inner rectangular prism (hollow center) Draw a smaller rectangle inside the previously drawn rectangle, with the same center but smaller dimensions. You can achieve this by creating four lines parallel to the original lines but offset by a certain distance. Step 4: Create the cylindrical hole Create a circle with its center at the intersection of the two rectangles and a radius that fits within the smaller rectangle. Then, use the circle as a guide to create an arc that connects the two parallel lines of the smaller rectangle, forming a cylindrical hole. Step 5: Scale the 2D sketch Scale the entire 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75, which is the value of "sketch_scale" in the JSON data. Step 6: Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch Apply a 3D rotation using the euler angles provided (0.0, 0.0, 0.0) and a translation vector of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. Step 7: Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis by a distance of 0.6587 (the value of "extrude_depth_towards_normal") to create the 3D model of the part. Step 8: Define the operation to combine this part with preceding CAD models As the operation for this part is "NewBodyFeatureOperation", this part will be added to the final CAD model as a new solid body. At this point, you should have a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a hollow center and a cylindrical hole in the center of the hollow prism. The top and bottom faces are parallel and the front and back faces are perpendicular to the top and bottom faces. The sides of the prism are rectangular and the edges are straight. The hollow center is a smaller rectangular prism with the same dimensions as the outer prism. The prisms are connected by a cylindrical hole. The length, width, and height are determined by the dimensions provided in the "description" section of the JSON data.</description>
